title: How Often Should You Wash Relaxed Hair?

steps.title: Wait one week after getting your relaxer.
steps.content: Wait one week after getting your relaxer. Don't shampoo your hair right away because it'll dry out your hair more, leaving it brittle. [1] X Research source The chemicals in a relaxer break down your hair to change its texture, which leaves your hair really dry and prone to damage. [2] X Expert Source Mindy Nguyen Holistic Cosmetologist Expert Interview. 8 October 2021. Shampooing your hair too early will strip more of the moisture away. [3] X Research source This is really a personal choice. If your scalp doesn’t feel dirty, go ahead and delay washing your hair a few extra days. [4] X Expert Source Mindy Nguyen Holistic Cosmetologist Expert Interview. 8 October 2021. It's okay to go as long as 10 days before shampooing your scalp. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Wash your hair once a week with a sulfate-free shampoo.
steps.content: Wash your hair once a week with a sulfate-free shampoo. Designate one day a week for shampooing your hair. [6] X Research source Pick a shampoo that’s formulated for relaxed hair that doesn't contain any alcohol. [7] X Research source Rinse it out completely so the shampoo doesn’t dry out your hair. [8] X Research source For example, you might wash your hair every Saturday.

steps.title: Condition your hair after you wash it.
steps.content: Condition your hair after you wash it. Use a conditioner that’s formulated for relaxed hair. Alternatively, do a deep conditioning treatment or oil treatment after shampooing your hair to add back moisture. [9] X Research source Follow the directions on your deep conditioner or oil treatment so it works like it’s designed.

steps.title: Use a wide-tooth comb and leave-in conditioner to detangle wet hair.
steps.content: Use a wide-tooth comb and leave-in conditioner to detangle wet hair. Don’t use a brush on wet hair because it’ll cause damage. Start by spraying your hair with a leave-in product. Then, carefully pick out tangles or knots with a wide-tooth comb, working from your ends up to your roots. [10] X Research source Pick a leave-in conditioner that’s labeled for use on relaxed hair for best results. Follow the directions on your product to apply it.

steps.title: Brush dry hair with a boar bristle brush to remove tangles.
steps.content: Brush dry hair with a boar bristle brush to remove tangles. Choose a brush that’s designed for textured or relaxed hair. Gently brush your hair, starting at the ends, to smooth it out. Don’t brush your hair unless it’s tangled because overbrushing can cause split ends and breakage. [11] X Research source For instance, you might brush your hair in the morning to style it.

steps.title: Put on a silk scarf before working out to soak up sweat.
steps.content: Put on a silk scarf before working out to soak up sweat. Fold the hair scarf into a triangle, then place the folded edge along the nape of your neck at your hairline. Pull the sides of the scarf forward and tie a big knot at the top of your forehead. Tug the tip of the triangle forward so that the scarf is tight, then wrap the sides around the back of your head and knot them at the nape of your neck. Tuck the tip of the triangle up into the wrapped scarf to complete the wrap. [12] X Research source Don’t wrap your hair too tightly. Just secure it well enough to keep it in place while you workout. If you put your hair in a ponytail, it's okay to use a sweatband to wick away sweat and keep your edges in place. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Sleep in a hair wrap to protect your hair and keep it smooth.
steps.content: Sleep in a hair wrap to protect your hair and keep it smooth. Wrap your hair just like you would for working out. Position your scarf or bonnet so that it’s not rubbing against your hairline, which can lead to hair loss. Then, carefully wrap and secure it. Make sure your scarf feels comfortable. If it doesn’t, re-wrap it before going to bed. [14] X Research source You can also sleep in a silk bonnet if that’s more comfortable to you. However, a scarf helps keep your hair straighter.

steps.title: Do deep conditioning or oil treatments biweekly.
steps.content: Do deep conditioning or oil treatments biweekly. [15] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Coat your hair with deep conditioner or oil from the ends to near your scalp. Cover your hair with a plastic cap and sit under a hooded dryer set to low heat if you can. Allow the treatment to sit for 30 to 45 minutes, then rinse it out. [16] X Research source It’s okay to use oil treatments weekly if you prefer. Since relaxed hair is drier, you might want to add more moisture. Keep the product off of your scalp because it can cause oiliness.

steps.title: Limit how often you use heat styling tools.
steps.content: Limit how often you use heat styling tools. Don’t use heat unless it’s really necessary because your hair is more susceptible to damage after a relaxer. [17] X Research source Additionally, choose tools that have ceramic plates because they’re less damaging to hair. If you do use heat, always apply a heat protectant to your hair before you style it. This will help protect your locks and may even make your hair look shinier. [18] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Since your hair is relaxed, it should look soft and smooth without the use of heat styling tools.

steps.title: Get trims every 6 to 8 weeks to get rid of split ends.
steps.content: Get trims every 6 to 8 weeks to get rid of split ends. Make regular appointments with your stylist to trim your ends. [19] X Research source This keeps your hair looking soft and smooth because your ends won’t be damaged. You might think getting trims would prevent your hair from growing long, but it actually helps you get more length. If you don’t trim split ends, your hair will keep splitting up the shaft, causing more breakage. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Touch up new growth every 2 to 3 months for healthier hair.
steps.content: Touch up new growth every 2 to 3 months for healthier hair. Frequency of touch-ups depends on your hair type and growth speed. Talk to your stylist to find out when they recommend a touch-up. Then, schedule your appointments in advance. [21] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source You’ll need more touch-ups if your hair grows quickly, it’s very textured, or you sweat a lot. Follow their advice to help your hair look its best. [22] X Research source If you relax your hair at home, apply the relaxer to only your new growth. Don’t put relaxer on already treated hair because it’ll cause damage.
